intro: Ligustrum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf privet, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 2–5 inches long and have a smooth, dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters during the spring, which are followed by dark blue berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types. Ligustrum lanceolatum is also used in landscaping for its ability to thrive in both sun and partial shade.
